Prerequisites: ACG 2011 WITH A GRADE OF "C" OR HIGHER
Course Description:
THIS COURSE PREPARES THE STUDENT FOR PRACTICAL ANALYSIS AND USAGE OF ACCOUNTING DATA BY MANAGEMENT IN THE AREAS OF FINANCIAL STATEMENTS, BUDGETING, RESPONSIBILITY ACCOUNTING, AND COST AND
PROFIT ANALYSIS.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
AT THE COMPLETION OF THE COURSE, THE STUDENT WILL BE ABLE TO:
1.  DEFINE COST AND MANAGERIAL TERMS FOR INTERNAL REPORTING PURPOSES
2.  SET-UP AND EXPLAIN JOB ORDER SYSTEMS AND PROCESS COST SYSTEMS
3.  PERFORM MATHEMATICAL CALCULATIONS OF THE COST OF GOODS MANUFACTURED AND SOLD SCHEDULES
4.  PREPARE VARIOUS BUDGETS
5.  CALCULATE VARIANCES, ALLOCATION OF SUPPORT AREAS TO PRODUCTION AREAS AND ALLOCATION OF JOINT AND BY-PRODUCT COSTS
6.  PREPARE FINANCIAL STATEMENT ANALYSIS
7.  EXPLAIN RESPONSIBILITY AND ITS RAMIFICATIONS WITHIN THE MANUFACTURING CONCERN.
Transfer Status: GUARANTEED TRANSFER TO INSTITUTION OFFERING SAME COURSE.
